name: Roti
history: Roti, also known as chapati, is a staple flatbread in Indian cuisine. Its roots can be traced back to the Indus Valley civilization. It's a simple, versatile bread made with just a few ingredients and cooked on a flat griddle.
description: Roti is a soft, unleavened flatbread made primarily from whole wheat flour. It is a daily bread in many Indian households, served with a variety of dishes. Roti is known for its simplicity and health benefits, being low in fat and high in fiber.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: Mix whole wheat flour and salt. Gradually add water and knead to form a soft, pliable dough. Cover and let it rest for 15 minutes.

instructions.title: Roll the Rotis
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball into a thin, flat circle using a rolling pin.

instructions.title: Cook the Rotis
instructions.description: Heat a flat griddle or tawa. Place a rolled-out roti on it and cook until small bubbles appear. Flip and cook the other side until brown spots appear. Optionally, brush with oil or ghee.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the rotis hot with a curry, dal, or any other side dish.

tips: Ensure the dough is soft and well-rested for soft rotis.
Use a cast-iron griddle for even cooking and perfect browning.
variations: Add herbs or spices like cumin seeds to the dough for added flavor.
Make stuffed rotis with fillings like spiced potatoes or paneer.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh but can be stored in an airtight container for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Reheat on a griddle before serving if stored.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a hot griddle or tawa until warm and soft.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional roti basket lined with a cloth.
Pair with a variety of dips and side dishes for a complete meal.
